reviewText:
Well, this was disappointing.

The game looks like a Beat em all similar to arcade classics but in reality it's just a stupid run & gun (without gun) with 4 buttons to attack + 2 for specials and 3 lanes to move (your character is always going forward, you can only go up or down), the levels are divided into stages and worlds, kinda like a mobile game. The fake CRT effect is not enjoyable, it can be turned off to see the true nature of this thing.

If you ignore the zombies and tries to continue in an empty lane you'll get teleported in front of the zombie and get hit.

Why the heck is it locked at 24hz in 1920x1080? also, don't tab out. Your game may crash/freeze.

reviewText: OK, so this game wasn't what I was expecting.\n\nWhen I saw the trailer and screenshots, I assumed this to be something like the old-school CPS1 beat-em-ups I used to play in arcades when I was a teenager, like Final Fight, Alien Vs. Predator, Cadillacs & Dinosaurs, etc. Hell, even the attract screens are similar, what with the Winners Don't Use Drugs" and all (followed by brawling through streets lined with headshops and bongs in the windows
hoursPlayed: being the old-fashioned thirtysomething gamer that I am
voteText: I pulled out my arcade stick
votesHelpful: and dropped it in my lap
votesTotal: ready to lay the smack down on some zombie ♥♥♥.\n\nHOWEVER... what the trailers and screenshots don't really tell you is that this isn't the '90s brawler it's framed up to be. Instead
votesFunny: it's like a mash-up of a mobile phone auto-runner and a rhythm game. Put Guitar Hero on its side
commentsCount: turn the falling skittles into zombies with crosshair hitboxes
column16: turn your star power into lightning bolts and weed whackers
column17: and you've got this game.\n\nThat's not to say it's bad. After getting over the "this isn't what I expected" factor
column18: I started to enjoy the game. I think I got my $5 worth from it
column19: I just feel that other people should be made aware of what the game really is before they buy it
column20: as I'm seeing a lot of disappointed reviewers saying they expected the same as I did."

reviewText:
Well, that was NOT what i was expecting.
...actually it's better that expected.
I'm not a fan of Beat-em-ups myself, just because i haven't played any of them in my childhood, except for Fighting Force, but it was 3D and pretty different in gameplay than classic 2D Beat-em-ups. Plus, as a huge character action nut, i'm too used to fast and stylish combat.
So, i wasn't really dissapointed with this game not being a classic beat-em-up.
It's more like... a rhythm game. Without music base.
Let me explain.
The story is as simple as John Wick - some guys stole your pet (a very grumpy cat), it's time to get it back and kick ♥♥♥.
Gameplay consists of you endlesly running to the right, while zombies and other guys run towards you.
Your dude (who looks totally awesome imho) has 4 attacks according to 4 face buttons - upper attack, forward attack, down attack and backward attack. Though, your main ones are first three, because backward one only used to punch zombies running from the left. They can also be chained in combo.
But you don't just punch them as you want, you need to attack them right in time, you want to aim for a perfect strike. Not only because it gives you more points and multiplier, but also because its needed for more effective killing, like some of zombies can be killed in one perfect instead of two normal strikes and so one.
Also, some enemies require using specific attacks in order to defeat them or to dismember them in order two acquiring projectile that can be used to kill more zombies.
You see, this game has so much killing and styling potential, you just need to understand how everything works, which is not hard considering that this game has a nice How to Play" that tells you everything you need.
And even if it IS repetetive
hoursPlayed: there's one But...\nWhat the hell this game has in common with Dead Island?\nNo
helpfulPercent: there's not much of Dead Island except zombies and tropics."

reviewText: Fun retro game which has the player auto-running from left to right. The game feels soild and even keyboard controls feel good. You feel OP but the number of zombies on screen, will a good few times send you back to the menu screen. Clearly hints to old 10p arcade cabinets with winners don't use drugs" and even a faded "A + Enter" button burnt on to the montior during play :)."

reviewText: People should lighten up, this game is obviously made with humour. The video options have choices for metaphysical shading and mfaa x100100  so its to be taken tongue in cheek fashion. Its got Jack Black and one of the super weapons in a weed whacker with saw blades.\n\nFor what it is its, fun. An endless runner combined with rythem beat em up action. You rip tear and electrocute your way through a series of stages against everything from Zombie yuppy joggers to zombie dogs. including one type that looks suspsiciously like a Boomer from Left4Dead.  All in all fun stuff, just don\'t come into it expecting dark souls as a side scroller.
